result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter C Timpano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter C Timpano

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - regular
Sentencing hearing on September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact w/1615 St. Clair Street, Racine WI. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Peter C Timpano in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Peter C Timpano in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
On a plea to the charge, State moves to remove the repeater enhancer.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.   Repeater enhancer removed.
There is a stipulation to amend the bond.
BTC: Amend bond to $900 signature bond, all other conditions remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact w/1615 St. Clair Street, Racine WI. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Peter C Timpano in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Peter C Timpano in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Atty was just appointed to this matter.
Def requests that the bond be modified to under $1000 so that he can be an inmate worker.
State does not object.
BTC: Modify bond to $900 cash, all other conditions remain.
Lori Kuehn

Defendant Peter C Timpano in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft's atty has failed to appear again.
BTC: Order that the atty is to be removed from this case. Clerk to contact the SPD's office to get a new atty.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State has extended an offer.

Def would move address bond at this time.
